item.title: How do I make text appear inside an interface?
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

no Ctrl + H = find and replace…

sq("@dre@title", 8144); // Title clearQuestInterface(); sendQuest("@dbl@text", 8145); sendQuest("@dbl@text, 8147); sendQuest("@dbl@text, 8148); sendQuestSomething(8143); showInterface(8134); flushOutStream(); thats just an ordinary simple interface. text lines are different on each interface i think so you just have to search around.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make text appear inside an interface?

item.title: How do I make text appear inside an interface?
item.dc:creator: @RID22 RID22
item.description:
@RID22 wrote:

[quote=“killerblues, post:10, topic:280968”][quote author=davedave link=topic=371051.msg2803587#msg2803587 date=1243585428]
Does anyone know a way to find the line number without getting a headache?
[/quote] press CRL+ H and in the find bar paste that in (if it is exactly what it says)[/quote]

Ctrl + H = History?

Ctrl + F = Find.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make text appear inside an interface?
item.dc:creator: @Holy_Archer Holy Archer
item.description:
@Holy_Archer wrote:

You have to find the text-lines.

sendQuest(“TEXT”, #LineForText#);

item.title: How do I make text appear inside an interface?
item.dc:creator: @davedave davedave
item.description:
@davedave wrote:

Right now I’m using the interface ‘1194’, and I have no idea how to put text inside it…

I’ve tried:

sendQuest("text goes in here", 1194); sendQuest("", 1194); sendQuest("text goes in here", 1194);

Read full topic
